result.execSummary:
The defendant Garnett M Betts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including psychological and or psychiatric counseling, and an AODA assessment. Take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician. No contact with any Walgreens or CVS Pharmacy Stores. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes:
stayed.
***8-26-15 AMENDED:  Lift of stayed conditional time - defendant to serve 30 days with credit from 8-14-15.***

Status conference on May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim stores, CVS Pharmancy and Walgreens, except for restitution purposes.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Garnett M Betts in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Garnett M Betts in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
